items.description: Key Insights Significantly high institutional ownership implies Salesforce's stock price is sensitive to their trading...

items.title: GPUs Are So 2024 -- This Is 2025's Hottest Trend for the $15.7 Trillion Artificial Intelligence (AI) Revolution
items.description: Hardware won't be the apple of AI investors' eyes in the new year.

items.title: 1 Vanguard ETF to Ride the Agentic and Physical AI Revolution in 2025
items.author: George Budwell
items.description: The article discusses the rise of agentic AI and physical AI, and how the Vanguard Information Technology ETF (VGT) provides exposure to companies developing these transformative technologies. The ETF's large-cap focus and diversified approach help manage risk as these AI subsectors move from conception to reality.

insights.sentiment_reasoning: Apple is one of the largest holdings in the Vanguard Information Technology ETF, representing the vanguard of technology innovation.
Nvidia is one of the largest holdings in the ETF and develops processors essential for the development of physical AI.
Microsoft is one of the largest holdings in the ETF and represents the vanguard of technology innovation.
Salesforce is a top-10 holding in the ETF and its established enterprise customer relationships could provide natural distribution channels for future AI technologies.
Oracle is a top-10 holding in the ETF and its established enterprise customer relationships could provide natural distribution channels for future AI technologies.
Broadcom is a semiconductor company that develops processors essential for the development of physical AI, and is held in the ETF.
Advanced Micro Devices is a semiconductor company that develops processors essential for the development of physical AI, and is held in the ETF.
The ETF provides exposure to companies developing agentic AI and physical AI technologies, with a focus on established technology leaders to help manage risk.
